Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

Yikes.Let’s do better — not just for ourselves, but for the recruiters, hiring managers, and the system overall.Be thoughtful. Read carefully. Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

Job Application Rule #1: Read the Job Description(Yes, actually read it!)Saw a job post today — went live just an hour ago…Already 100+ applications.Either we’ve got The Flash ⚡ out here applying, or folks are hitting “Apply” like it’s a game show buzzerHere’s what happens when you don’t read the JD:- HR ends up drowning in irrelevant resumes 🫠- The process slows down for everyone ⏳- And the window may close before the right person even gets a chance 🚪❌Example: The job says “5+ years of experience in L&D with stakeholder management” — and someone with a 3-month internship in a totally different field applies. Yikes.Let’s do better — not just for ourselves, but for the recruiters, hiring managers, and the system overall.Be thoughtful. Read carefully. Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

We question. Yikes.Let’s do better — not just for ourselves, but for the recruiters, hiring managers, and the system overall.Be thoughtful. Read carefully. Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

Job Application Rule #1: Read the Job Description(Yes, actually read it!)Saw a job post today — went live just an hour ago…Already 100+ applications.Either we’ve got The Flash ⚡ out here applying, or folks are hitting “Apply” like it’s a game show buzzerHere’s what happens when you don’t read the JD:- HR ends up drowning in irrelevant resumes 🫠- The process slows down for everyone ⏳- And the window may close before the right person even gets a chance 🚪❌Example: The job says “5+ years of experience in L&D with stakeholder management” — and someone with a 3-month internship in a totally different field applies. Yikes.Let’s do better — not just for ourselves, but for the recruiters, hiring managers, and the system overall.Be thoughtful. Read carefully. Username: Fetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)ExpertFetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)Expert
Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

Job Application Rule #1: Read the Job Description(Yes, actually read it!)Saw a job post today — went live just an hour ago…Already 100+ applications.Either we’ve got The Flash ⚡ out here applying, or folks are hitting “Apply” like it’s a game show buzzerHere’s what happens when you don’t read the JD:- HR ends up drowning in irrelevant resumes 🫠- The process slows down for everyone ⏳- And the window may close before the right person even gets a chance 🚪❌Example: The job says “5+ years of experience in L&D with stakeholder management” — and someone with a 3-month internship in a totally different field applies. Yikes.Let’s do better — not just for ourselves, but for the recruiters, hiring managers, and the system overall.Be thoughtful. Read carefully. Username: Fetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)ExpertFetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)Expert
Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

Yikes.Let’s do better — not just for ourselves, but for the recruiters, hiring managers, and the system overall.Be thoughtful. Read carefully. Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

Yikes.Let’s do better — not just for ourselves, but for the recruiters, hiring managers, and the system overall.Be thoughtful. Read carefully. Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

Username: Fetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)ExpertFetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)Expert
Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

We question. Yikes.Let’s do better — not just for ourselves, but for the recruiters, hiring managers, and the system overall.Be thoughtful. Read carefully. Username: Fetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)ExpertFetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)Expert
Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

Username: Fetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)ExpertFetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)Expert
Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

Job Application Rule #1: Read the Job Description(Yes, actually read it!)Saw a job post today — went live just an hour ago…Already 100+ applications.Either we’ve got The Flash ⚡ out here applying, or folks are hitting “Apply” like it’s a game show buzzerHere’s what happens when you don’t read the JD:- HR ends up drowning in irrelevant resumes 🫠- The process slows down for everyone ⏳- And the window may close before the right person even gets a chance 🚪❌Example: The job says “5+ years of experience in L&D with stakeholder management” — and someone with a 3-month internship in a totally different field applies. Yikes.Let’s do better — not just for ourselves, but for the recruiters, hiring managers, and the system overall.Be thoughtful. Read carefully. Username: Fetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)ExpertFetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)Expert
Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

Job Application Rule #1: Read the Job Description(Yes, actually read it!)Saw a job post today — went live just an hour ago…Already 100+ applications.Either we’ve got The Flash ⚡ out here applying, or folks are hitting “Apply” like it’s a game show buzzerHere’s what happens when you don’t read the JD:- HR ends up drowning in irrelevant resumes 🫠- The process slows down for everyone ⏳- And the window may close before the right person even gets a chance 🚪❌Example: The job says “5+ years of experience in L&D with stakeholder management” — and someone with a 3-month internship in a totally different field applies. Yikes.Let’s do better — not just for ourselves, but for the recruiters, hiring managers, and the system overall.Be thoughtful. Read carefully. Username: Fetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)ExpertFetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)Expert
Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

Username: Fetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)ExpertFetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)Expert
Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

Job Application Rule #1: Read the Job Description(Yes, actually read it!)Saw a job post today — went live just an hour ago…Already 100+ applications.Either we’ve got The Flash ⚡ out here applying, or folks are hitting “Apply” like it’s a game show buzzerHere’s what happens when you don’t read the JD:- HR ends up drowning in irrelevant resumes 🫠- The process slows down for everyone ⏳- And the window may close before the right person even gets a chance 🚪❌Example: The job says “5+ years of experience in L&D with stakeholder management” — and someone with a 3-month internship in a totally different field applies. Yikes.Let’s do better — not just for ourselves, but for the recruiters, hiring managers, and the system overall.Be thoughtful. Read carefully. Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

We question. We find out.And yes, we always will.To the honest ones out there:✔️ Keep showing up with integrity — it will always set you apart.To the others:⚠️ The truth catches up, sooner or later.hashtag#HRDiaries hashtag#HiringLessons hashtag#WorkEthics hashtag#RealTalk hashtag#HRCommunity hashtag#ProfessionalIntegrity hashtag#StayAuthentic

Job Application Rule #1: Read the Job Description(Yes, actually read it!)Saw a job post today — went live just an hour ago…Already 100+ applications.Either we’ve got The Flash ⚡ out here applying, or folks are hitting “Apply” like it’s a game show buzzerHere’s what happens when you don’t read the JD:- HR ends up drowning in irrelevant resumes 🫠- The process slows down for everyone ⏳- And the window may close before the right person even gets a chance 🚪❌Example: The job says “5+ years of experience in L&D with stakeholder management” — and someone with a 3-month internship in a totally different field applies. Yikes.Let’s do better — not just for ourselves, but for the recruiters, hiring managers, and the system overall.Be thoughtful. Read carefully. Username: Fetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)ExpertFetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)Expert
Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

Username: Fetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)ExpertFetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)Expert
Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

We find out.And yes, we always will.To the honest ones out there:✔️ Keep showing up with integrity — it will always set you apart.To the others:⚠️ The truth catches up, sooner or later.hashtag#HRDiaries hashtag#HiringLessons hashtag#WorkEthics hashtag#RealTalk hashtag#HRCommunity hashtag#ProfessionalIntegrity hashtag#StayAuthentic

Job Application Rule #1: Read the Job Description(Yes, actually read it!)Saw a job post today — went live just an hour ago…Already 100+ applications.Either we’ve got The Flash ⚡ out here applying, or folks are hitting “Apply” like it’s a game show buzzerHere’s what happens when you don’t read the JD:- HR ends up drowning in irrelevant resumes 🫠- The process slows down for everyone ⏳- And the window may close before the right person even gets a chance 🚪❌Example: The job says “5+ years of experience in L&D with stakeholder management” — and someone with a 3-month internship in a totally different field applies. Yikes.Let’s do better — not just for ourselves, but for the recruiters, hiring managers, and the system overall.Be thoughtful. Read carefully. Username: Fetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)ExpertFetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)Expert
Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

Job Application Rule #1: Read the Job Description(Yes, actually read it!)Saw a job post today — went live just an hour ago…Already 100+ applications.Either we’ve got The Flash ⚡ out here applying, or folks are hitting “Apply” like it’s a game show buzzerHere’s what happens when you don’t read the JD:- HR ends up drowning in irrelevant resumes 🫠- The process slows down for everyone ⏳- And the window may close before the right person even gets a chance 🚪❌Example: The job says “5+ years of experience in L&D with stakeholder management” — and someone with a 3-month internship in a totally different field applies. Yikes.Let’s do better — not just for ourselves, but for the recruiters, hiring managers, and the system overall.Be thoughtful. Read carefully. Username: Fetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)ExpertFetiye Bektas The International Trade and Finance (CITF®)Expert
Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics

𝐂𝐚𝐮𝐠𝐡𝐭 𝐫𝐞𝐝-𝐡𝐚𝐧𝐝𝐞𝐝 — 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐬𝐭𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐞𝐝 𝐭𝐨 𝐰𝐚𝐥𝐤 𝐚𝐰𝐚𝐲 𝐥𝐢𝐤𝐞 𝐧𝐨𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐡𝐚𝐩𝐩𝐞𝐧𝐞𝐝.We recently hired someone who seemed like a perfect fit — confident in interviews, solid experience on paper, and everything checked out… at first.Then came the background check:❌ Fake experience certificate❌ Lied about work durationWhen we confronted her (politely!), she first denied everything… and minutes later said, “I’m not comfortable working here.”Just like that — the excuses began.𝐖𝐡𝐲 𝐢𝐬 𝐢𝐭 𝐭𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐰𝐡𝐞𝐧 𝐩𝐞𝐨𝐩𝐥𝐞 𝐠𝐞𝐭 𝐜𝐚𝐮𝐠𝐡𝐭, 𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐲 𝐝𝐨𝐧’𝐭 𝐭𝐚𝐤𝐞 𝐚𝐜𝐜𝐨𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐚𝐛𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐲 — 𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐲 𝐣𝐮𝐬𝐭 𝐫𝐮𝐧?This isn’t just about documents — it’s about character.𝐀𝐬 𝐇𝐑, 𝐰𝐞’𝐫𝐞 𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐝 𝐭𝐨 𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐝 𝐛𝐞𝐭𝐰𝐞𝐞𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬.We verify. We question. We find out.And yes, we always will.To the honest ones out there:✔️ Keep showing up with integrity — it will always set you apart.To the others:⚠️ The truth catches up, sooner or later.hashtag#HRDiaries hashtag#HiringLessons hashtag#WorkEthics hashtag#RealTalk hashtag#HRCommunity hashtag#ProfessionalIntegrity hashtag#StayAuthentic

Post Content:
Rethinking the Value of Skilled Professionals in Foreign TradeIn many companies, hiring decisions often come down to one thing: budget.But from years of experience in foreign trade operations, I’ve learned that focusing solely on cost can be a short-sighted approach that costs far more in the long run.🧭 A skilled foreign trade professional does so much more than process paperwork.We manage risks, build strong supplier relationships, ensure smooth logistics, prevent costly delays, and protect your company from legal and compliance issues. That’s value you can’t measure by salary alone.💸 Hiring based on "cheaper" salaries may save you today, but here’s what it could cost you tomorrow:🚫 Missed shipments & lost customers 💰 Increased costs due to inefficiencies ⚠️ Damaged partner trust & reputation 📉 Financial losses that far exceed any salary savings👉 Invest in skill. Invest in stability.Foreign trade is more than just shipping goods — it’s about navigating currency risks, customs regulations, logistics, and supplier relations across borders. One mistake can lead to delays, fines, and lost business — far outweighing the initial savings on a lower salary.🔍 I believe in the value of skill, experience, and strategic investment.When organizations prioritize expertise, long-term growth, and a well-managed operation, the results speak for themselves. It’s not just about meeting short-term needs, but about creating a foundation for sustained success.We don’t just work. We coordinate. We prevent. We protect.hashtag#ForeignTrade hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SupplyChain hashtag#RiskManagement hashtag#SmartHiring hashtag#BusinessGrowth hashtag#Logistics
